title: putins cronies high ranking military
story: Putins cronies and high-ranking military need to face sanctions over Ukraine invasionThe UK Government has acted swtly in cutting off banks and banning Russian planes from our airspace but has lagged behind the US and the EU in imposing other sanctionsVladimir Putin ordered an invasion of Ukraine last week Image: via REUTERSopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Mar |comments Russiaaposs status as a pariah state was confirmed tonight when the United Nations General Assembly voted to condemn the invasion of Ukraine. The result reflects the world’s horror at the illegal actions of Vladimir Putin which has led to the slaughter of countless innocent lives.The words of condemnation must now be matched by a further tightening of the screw on Russian business and finance. The UK Government has acted swtly in cutting off banks and banning Russian planes from our airspace but has lagged behind the US and the EU in imposing other sanctions. Unlike Brussels we have still to freeze the assets of the members of the Russian Parliament. Dozens of Putin’s cronies and high-ranking military have yet to be targeted. The Tories have allowed London to become the world’s laundromat for Russian dirty money. They have also taken millions in donations from people with ties to the Kremlin. If they are serious about putting pressure on the Russian regime they should widen sanctions andthe donations. The longer they take to act, the more the suspicion grows that they are still in thrall to the oligarchs.  The best of us While Vladimir Putin has shown the worst of humanity with his brutal invasion, the public response to his vile actions has shown the best of humanity. Millions of people have donated to charities to help the people of Ukraine and the hundreds of thousands made homeless by the war. Some volunteers have even driven to the Polish-Ukrainian border to deliver much-needed medical supplies, food, clothes and toys for children. Their compassion has never been more necessary. A blood hound Hero dog Arnie is retiring after donating  pints of blood in his letime that have helped more than  other pets. Thankfully this real blood hound was not terrier-fied of needles. title: schools face cruel divides between
story: Schools face cruel ides between haves and have nots, MPs warnThe Public Accounts Committee warned the situation in Englands schools creates unacceptable dferences in le chances for childrenMPs warned of signicant iation and challenges for inidual schools Image: Getty ImagesByLizzy BuchanDeputy Online Political Editor:,  Mar |commentsSchools face “cruel ides between the haves and have nots”, a powerful committee of MPs warns today. The Public Accounts Committeeblasted the Government for relying on national figures which mask signicant iation and challenges for inidual schools. Its new report raised signicant concerns that more deprived schools were “faring worse than wealthier schools under a shake-up of pupil funding. The result is unacceptable dferences in le chances for children.The PAC accused the Department for Education of having “little assurance” that £. billion of promised funding “will be enough to cover cost pressures including the impact of the COVID- pandemic”. It said ministers lacked understanding about why there was so much regional iation in school finances, with over % of state schools in deficit in  local authorities as of March . Committee chairwoman Meg Hillier said: DfEaposs airy assurances about the healthy books of academies in particular mask some cruel ides between the haves and have nots, unacceptable dferences in le chances for our children and young people from the get-go, through no fault of their own. But we see the departmentaposs apparent disregard for the inequalities exposed and exacerbated in the pandemic in the catchup provision debacle, and in all the children and their families still struggling, years after the promised review, with the poor provision for special educational needs and disabilities. Rather than the department blithely looking for laurels to rest on, it must grasp that itaposs not OK for any group of our children to be abandoned in the system that it oversees.Geoff Barton, general secretary of the Association of School and College Leaders, said: It is not only the Public Accounts Committee that is frustrated by the Department for Educationaposs blithe insistence that schools have never had it so good.So are school leaders, who have to live with the reality of severely straitened budgets. Shadow Schools Minister Stephen Morgan said childrenaposs education had been damaged by a decade of Tory rule. He said: “Ministers are increasingly demanding school leaders do more with less and it’s narrowing childrenaposs opportunities, hitting those in poorer communities hardest.A Department for Education spokesperson said: Investment in schools is rising – we have confirmed an overall £.bn increase to the core school budget by - and will continue to deliver year on year, real terms per pupil increases, including a % real terms per pupil boost in -.“Schools across the country continue to have high standards of financial management and governance, with the latest published data showing that .% of academy trusts and .% of maintained schools have balanced accounts. We take appropriate action where necessary to support all trusts and schools with this.“We also continue to improve our School Resource Management offer of guidance, tools, and direct support which is available to all state schools to help them target their resources to support pupils.”Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Conservative PartyMeg HillierEducationSchoolsPolitics" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: vlad invaders nuclear trigger talks
story: © Martin Rowson." content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _JS.jpg" width"" "" Ukraine will prove fatal, Kevin Maguire says Image: Martin RowsonopinionByKevin MaguireAssociate editor:,  Feb |commentsPariah Putin’s paranoid desperation is increasingly dangerous yet tightening global strangulation should finally signal the end for this Kremlin crackpot. Ukraine will prove the fatal, final mistake by a fascistic gangster who egotistically believed his own invincible propaganda after strategic triumphs in Crimea and Syria, and the  Trump and Brexit blows delivered to the US and UK. Vlad the Invader’s twitchy finger on the nuclear trigger and the offer of Potemkin negotiations are both signs even he fears this is an impending personal Armageddon. This is fuelled by brave Ukrainians fighting heroically and Russians courageously protesting “No to War”, which is inspiring resistance around the world. Supplying anti-tank, helicopter and aircraft missiles strengthens defenders and weakens attackers already suffering punishing losses. Britain, the rest of Europe and the US finally uniting over economic and cultural sanctions will eventually bankrupt the Putin machine and perhaps drive a deep wedge between the tyrant and his billionaire cronies who enjoy opulent luxury wherever they please.  And China abstaining instead of vetoing a UN Security Council motion by the US condemning the brutal invasion emphasised Putin’s isolation, as a new ally quickly distanced itself from an ageing, deranged dictator. The bloody conflict could still belong: reducing Ukrainian neighbourhoods to rubble, inflicting unbearable heartache and costing countless lives. What is becoming clearer, however, is that Putin is also likely to be one of the victims. But let’s not buy charlatan Boris Johnson’s propaganda that he is suddenly an international statesman, a Prime Minister orchestrating the resistance. Johnson let Putin walk all over him and Britain, with oligarchs smirking unconcerned whenever ruling Conservatives, reliant on Russian-linked money, talked tough then acted soft.Charismatic, cool-headed, defiant Ukrainian Volodymyr Zelensky is what a real leader looks and sounds like. Germany’s centre-Left Olaf Scholz is also rising to the occasion, standing up to Putin at considerable financial expense. A European Union that Johnson ripped Britain from as part of a career move was firmer on sanctions until shamed Johnson started running to catch up. Locking out Ukrainian refugees fleeing terror unless they apply to be fruit pickers is disgraceful and inhuman, when Poland, Romania and Hungary open their borders. Why not seize the spacious British properties of Russian oligarchs to house Putin’s casualties  I’ve watched and known Johnson for longer than the  years Putin has misruled Russia. So I’m aware of the cynicism of the great charlatan. From coronavirus to Brexit, our daily politics newsletter is there to guide you these turbulent times. The newsletter is sent out twice daily with the latest UK  world politics news, along with leading opinion and analysis.You can sign up here.  The first casualty of war is Partygate, with Johnson relieved that the shells and missiles are effectively providing a smokescreen. If he’s hit by a fine, the PM will pray it is today. Now wouldn’t be the moment to remove a lawbreaker in Downing Street, his apologists will argue. They’d be wrong, of course. Chamberlain was dumped by MPs to be replaced by Churchill during the Second World War then, before Japan finally surrendered, the country swapped Churchill for Attlee. Labour leader Keir Starmer will inevitably receive less airtime than the PM but should have calculated that he must be constructively critical rather than mercilessly pummelling the Tory rogue. War in Europe might save Johnsonnot an invaded country or Putin. title: 18 day old baby tragically
story: -day-old baby tragically died from suffocation after dad took drugs and fell asleepNewborn baby Hunter died from "positional asphyxia" after his father Adam White, , fell asleep while caring for himMum Teri Walters was also in the house at the time of baby Hunters death and had been taking drugs and gone to bed Image: Nottinghamshire Live BPM MEDIAByRebecca SherdleyLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar |commentsAn -day-old baby has sadly died because of a lack oxygen and blood flow to the brain after his dad fell asleep and he was unable to move or breath. Newborn Hunter passed away of positional asphyxia while his father, Adam White, was caring for him, Nottingham Crown Court heard. White, , fell asleep under the influence of something, and the little one, facedown, died. Mum Terri Walters, , was in the house at the time and had also been taking drugs and went to bed.The tragedy unfolded in July , reports NottinghamshireLive. Judge Gregory Dickinson QC Judge Dickinson described how Walters had not been in the dock, where a defendant normally is, on Monday, February .  On Monday the dock was empty, he said. The defendant, very, very distressed, left the court building, and it was necessary to issue a warrant for her arrest. She was brought back to court this morning and spent time with her very experienced and very good barrister and solicitor. Now she has pleaded guilty. This case concerns the death of a three-week-old baby. The baby died as a result of what is called apospositional asphyxiaapos. The baby was facedown and could not breathe or move and died of asphyxia. This defendant and her partner were mother and father.  They both have longstanding drug problems. The baby was in the care of father. He fell asleep under the influence of something. The baby, facedown, died. The mother was in the house, also taking drugs, went to bed, leaving the baby with the father when not safe to do. She pleaded guilty after being found and arrested by police. The parents of Hunter will be sentenced together on April  in the afternoon. He urged her to stay in close contact with her solicitors, who are doing the very best to help you. You will be back here for sentencing with Mr White and then, only then, will I decide what the sentence must be, the judge said. title: animal shelters overwhelmed bunnies owners
story: Exclusive: Animal shelters overwhelmed with bunnies as owners abandon pets after Covid pandemicThe RSPCA said its intake of bunnies has increased by a third with nearly  taken in last year, compared to  in . There are an estimated , rabbits kept as pets in the UKPaprika is at the Leybourne Animal Centre in Kent Image: RSPCAByNada FarhoudEnvironment editor:,  Mar |comments Animal shelters across the country are overwhelmed with unwanted rabbits bought or bred during the pandemic - making them now the UK’s most neglected pet. The RSPCA said its intake of bunnies has increased by a third with nearly  taken in last year, compared to  in .Vanessa Cunningham, director of care  veterinary Services at Wood Green, The Animals Charity, told how hers and other shelters are also at full capacity after seeing nearly a % increase. “Rabbits have been the most neglected pet species in the UK for many years, which has only been exacerbated by the overwhelming volume of rabbits that were bred and purchased during the pandemic,” she said.  “Many owners have now realised how much space and hard work rabbits require, or things have gotten out of controlthey inadvertently brought home an un-neutered male and female pair who began breeding.”There are an estimated , rabbits kept as pets in the UK. Google searches for ‘Rabbits for sale’ rose from , in April  to , in April . There was also a % increase in visitors to the RSPCA’s Find a Pet website for rehoming rabbits during the same period.But last year, , rabbits were classied as ‘neglected’ by the RSPCA, up from , in . Those abandoned in the same period also increased from , to , with calls received by the charity about the welfare of bunnies jumping from , to ,. But despite an influx of rabbits to RSPCA shelters, only , were rehomed in .  RSPCA rabbit welfare expert Dr Jane Tyson said: “Despite rabbits often being perceived as an ideal ‘starter pet’, they actually have very complex needs and are one of the most neglected pets in Britain. “They also have long le spans of around - years so are a big commitment for a family. “It means sadly the RSPCA deals with many calls about bunnies where they have been neglected or abandoned each year.  “When rabbits are bought on impulse, an owner may not realise how complex they are to care for and what a commitment caring for rabbits can be. “Whilst they can be hugely rewarding pets full of personality, they also need lots of stimulation and - crucially - space to ensure their welfare needs are being met.” The RSPCA says that anyone who has done their research and is certain they can provide the time, space, money and care, to please consider adopting one of the many rescue rabbits in need of a home instead of buying.  These include Storm and Betty are a pair of bonded rabbits who have been looking for a home at Great Ayton Animal Centre near Middlesbrough for two months. Ellie is one of  rabbits being carried for at the Manchester and Salford branch - twice as many as usual. She would love a quiet home with a placid male rabbit for companionship. Squishy is one of eight bunnies at a rehoming centre in Worcester, which has a list of  waiting to come in, while Paprika is at the Leybourne Animal Centre in Kent, also full to capacity with rabbits.  How to look after bunnies Rabbits need lots of space. A well-matched medium-sized pair need an enclosed and safe area of at least  metres by  metres wide and around one metre high to rest and exercise. A traditional small hutch is not suitable and could cause health and behaviour problems.Visit www.rspca.org.uk findapet to find rabbits available for rehoming near you. If your circumstances match, you will be required to pay a fee of around £- to help towards costs as all animals are neutered, chipped and vaccinated.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON GoogleRSPCAAnimalsDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: couple claim neighbour installed creepy
story: Couple claim neighbour installed creepy mannequin to stare into their bedroomRosie and Christopher Taylor-Davies took their case to the High Court claiming they were forced to live in "darkness" with the curtains drawn after Simon Cook propped a dummy up to directly face themRosie and Christopher Taylor-Davies complained of a mannequin placed in neighbours window Image: Champion NewsBySam Elliott-GibbsReporterNev Ayling:,  Mar |comments A couple claim their neighbour made their le hell after installing a mannequin dummy to stare into their bedroom from the loft window of his £.m home. Privacy-loving Rosie and Christopher Taylor-Davies have lost a High Court battle after the roof extension Simon Cook built sparked complaints from the husband and we.They claim they have been forced to live in darkness with the curtains drawn after neighbour installed a Velux window facing directly into their bedroom from his substantial home next door. Mr Cook was not a party to the case, which was an attempt by judicial review by Mr and Mrs Taylor-Davies to get the council to take action against him. The couple said the fact the window did not use frosted glass meant they had to resort to getting undressed behind a bookcase, the only point on their top floor where they could not be seen from his new window.  And to add insult to injury, married dad Mr Cook installed a blonde mannequin dummy in the window, making it appear that it was watching over their home. At the High Court, a senior judge said it showed Mr Cook did not take his neighboursapos privacy concerns seriously, but ruled that he had not breached planning rules by installing an openable window with clear glass. The court heard Mr Cook had applied for planning permission for the rooflight and a dormer beside it as part of extensive works to his home, in Dover House Road, close to Richmond Park, in . The work involved a roof extension with dormer windows on both sides and at the back, but Mr and Mrs Taylor-Davies objected to elements of the project, calling the windows an invasion of their privacy. The Velux directly overlooks our bed, they said, claiming that they would be overlooked day and night on their top floor, where they sleep and shower, and Mrs Taylor-Davies studies for her PhD in embroidery.  In February , the local council, London Borough of Wandsworth, gave Mr Cook planning permission for his extension, but laid down conditions that the dormer window should have obscured glass and be non-opening. However, council planning officers waived those rules for the Velux, because it faces the sky and would have less impact on neighbours. Challenging the councilaposs decision not to take enforcement action to make Mr Cook obscure the rooflight glass, their barrister Stephen Whale argued before High Court judge, Mrs Justice Lang, that the window had robbed them of their privacy. The neighbouring houses are on a slope so that Mr Cookaposs is higher than theirs, meaning that anyone looking out of the rooflight would be able to see directly into the Taylor-Daviesapos top floor, including a clear-sided shower box. But despite knowing of their concerns, their neighbour had added insult to injury by sometimes positioning a blonde mannequin in the window, facing out onto their property, he continued. It serves to give the impression, as presumably he intends, that there is a person at the window overlooking their property and invading their privacy, he told the court. It only adds to their distress. The overlooking of their property and the invasion of their privacy as a result of the Velux window is very distressing to them.There is no good reason for the Velux window to have clear glass or be openable as there is another window very close on the opposite wall. There would be no loss of amenity to Mr Cook were the Velux window to have opaque glass and be non-openable. The only thing the Velux window overlooks is the top floor of the claimantsapos house. The barrister said the council had been wrong in refusing to take enforcement action against Mr Cook in relation to the window. Giving judgment, Mrs Justice Lang said: Mr Cook periodically installs a mannequin in the roof light which gives the impression that there is a person at the window looking out at [the claimantsapos home]. This suggests to me that he is not taking the claimantsapos concerns seriously, and so he is unlikely to maintain obscuring film voluntarily. But she said there was nothing in the planning conditions obliging him to obscure the rooflightaposs glass. They only required Mr Cook to obscure his new dormer window, she said. She also noted that Mr Cook had added an obscuring film to part of the rooflight, although adding that it could easily be removed. The couple, both New Zealanders, moved into their home beside Richmond Park  years ago and raised a family there.Mrs Taylor-Davies, , is a costume designer, who has worked in TV, film and theatre, as well as winning a local council award for her campaign to make protective scrubs for medics during the Covid- pandemic.Her husband, Mr Taylor-Davies, , is a technical consultant and software designer. Speaking from his home after the court hearing, Mr Taylor-Davies said the mannequin is no longer at her station by the window. Weaposve lived here for more than  years, but we might have to move out because of all this, he explained. We canapost take a shower or get dressed without being overlooked, he said, adding that their only option was to keep the curtains drawn. Itaposs essentially like living in darkness, he said. title: drivers baffled double yellow lines
story: Drivers baffled by double yellow lines painted in alley too narrow for cars to fit downBemused motorists said the lines on Bird Cage Walk in Hanley served no purpose but a local councilor hit back with his own explanationDouble yellow lines painted down both sides of teeny Bird Cage Walk in Hanley have caused widespread bemusement Image: Stoke Sentinel   BPM MediaByHayley ParkerJoe Smith:,  Mar |commentsDrivers have been left scratching their heads at the decision to paint double yellow lines down both sides of a tiny street less than five feet wide.Bird Cage Walk in Hanley, Stoke-on-Trent, is ft in wide in places, prompting members of the public to question the need for the local council to paint the lines, with one calling it a waste of paint.Puzzled residents took to social media after the alleyway was featured in a story about fly-tipping, all asking the same question, why bother with the double-yellows With the standard width of a car being around ft in, no motorist would be able to fit along the alleyway, let alone park in there, StokeonTrentLive reports.Writing on StokeonTrentLiveaposs Facebook page, James Botham said: Double yellows each side  Looks like you could barely fit a scooter down there, never mind a car!Chris Adams added: Those double yellows are a bit academic to be honest, a waste of yellow paint. Sean Williams wrote: It has double yellow on both side  What are they expected go down there  Chris Steele quipped: Good job they’ve put double yellows there.  And Rachel Ashley had this suggestion: Whoever put the yellow lines there, it needs to be a red route. Some drivers not familiar with Hanley’s roads have nearly been caught out by their sat-navs which have directed them to turn up the street. The Taxpayersapos Alliance has previously dubbed the lines as aposan unnecessary use of resourcesapos. Chief executive John OaposConnell told StokeonTrentLive in : “Anyone with commonsense can see that this was probably an unnecessary use of resources.  “Council tax is a huge bill for families and they wonapost be pleased to see it spent in this way.apos But at the time Stoke-on-Trent City Councilaposs highways department defended the double yellow lines on Bird Cage Walk which were put there around  years ago. Councillor Daniel Jellyman, cabinet member for regeneration, transport and heritage, said: “These double yellow lines were put down around the turn of the century. When they weren’t there, people actually parked on the road and left items there. The lane is clearly not accessible all the way along to most cars, but it is accessible some of the way and motorbikes, scooters and service vehicles can and do gain access to the entire . “If only one side of the road had double yellow lines, there would be nothing to stop a motorbike, for example, parking on the other side effectively blocking the public highway. “Although they might look a bit peculiar at first glance, experience has taught us that these restrictions are necessary. It is not uncommon to see this type of thing across the country. Sometimes we have to do seemingly unusual things for valid reasons.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON VehiclesCouncil taxMotoring mishaps" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: family horrified after giving pet
story: Exclusive: Family horried after giving pet dog to Battersea only for him to be put down days laterGrace McAllister, , fought to have Bear, her beloved German Shepherd, released back to her after Battersea Dogs Home informed her he would be put to sleep just five days after arrivingGrace McAllister was devastated when Battersea had beloved dog Bear put down Image: Grace McAllisterByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A family was horried after sending their beloved puppy to Battersea Dogs  Cats Home only for him to be put to sleep days later.Grace McAllister and her parents made the dficult decision to sign their German Shepherd, Bear, one, to the London charity for re-homing after their landlord told them they could no longer keep him. Grace, , frantically fought to have her pet released back to her after being informed of the drastic decision five days in but ultimately felt powerless to stop it. Battersea said staff had concerns about Bearaposs behaviour during his brief time in its kennels and allegedly explained they didnapost have the time or resources needed to train him properly to a satisfactory level. Itaposs understood the dog did not bite or attack any people or animals while at the charity.Have you had a similar experience  Let us know at webnews@mirror It’s not what I wanted to do in the slightest but I physically had no other option, Grace told the Mirror, explaining why she gave him up. It’s gut-wrenching that I put my trust in a place that’s very well known and I have never heard a bad thing about Battersea until now. Within five days they’ve completely ruined a potential le. Bear had another  yearsnot more, and they’ve taken that away from him. During a routine inspection, months after the family adopted Bear, their landlord decided he could no longer stay at the property, classing him as a security dog, despite him being a regular pet. Grace, from Cambridgeshire, had looked at moving out so she could keep Bear but said she couldnapost afford anywhere  that allowed pets.After failing to persuade her landlord to re-consider and being unable to find a suitable adopter, she heavy-heartedly opted to move him to Battersea on January . On January  she was informed he would be put to sleep and he died on January . Grace said she understood Bear was a victim of abuse prior to her adopting him and would often get scared and bark at strangers. Dog behaviourist Blake Clark had one session with him when the family originally took him in and told the Mirror he was anxious but not remotely dangerous.Referring to how quickly a decision was made about Bear, Blake said heaposs worried it is a common thing.He believes staff possibly misunderstood Bearaposs initial reactiveness for aggression and the dog may have then simply become the victim of atick box exercise. For me, they didn’t understand behaviour for this to happen. For me, something’s gone massively wrong, he said. Grace said when she fought against the decision she was told they donapost have the time or resources to give Bear the amount of kennel training he needed, which she said rings alarm bells. She explained on signing him over Battersea assured her putting a dog down was a last resort and they have an unlimited time [for] training them.Basically, all the promises they’d made to me that he would have plenty of time, they didn’t give him that all, she said. Grace believes part of the issue was Bearaposs breed despite the charity assuring her during the intake process they donapost discriminate. They told me they didn’t get chance to do an assessment with him...so I don’t understand [how] in five days they’ve come to that conclusion. In an email the day after he arrived - seen by the Mirror - Grace says a staff member told her Bear was nervous but they would do everything they could to help him. Grace described Bear as very jumpy and he took a while to settle when faced with new people or in new environments. But that he was an amazing, kind, beautul, gentle dog. I have seizures and he was actually alerting me when I was going to have a seizure. He would go and get someone  to help orno one was around he would keep me safe, she said. Due to Bear being legally the property of Battersea once signed over, Grace and Blake claim they found it almost impossible to come to a compromise. Blake - a dog behaviourist for  years - offered to adopt Bear himself, or even travel down to London regularly to train him for free, but said he kept being met with barriers until it was too late. Grace said she was told releasing him would be dficult due to restrictions imposed - but they did not elaborate. It was very backwards and forwards about their policies, she said. In the email telling Grace the dog would be put to sleep - also seen by the Mirror - a member of staff referred to signicant concerns about Bearaposs behaviour. They said when attempting to take him out of his kennel to a secure exercise area he displayed strong reactions to staff on-site from a distance as well as dogs - but failed to give any specics.  The email went on to say in the following days he continued to display concerning reactions, which included growling and dficulty in recovering from those reactions even in low pressure situations and environments. It added the behaviour and kennel management teams discussed the issues and having considered all the options available to us we have come to the dficult decision to put Bear to sleep. Blake said some dogs are too far gone to be helped due to too much trauma and cannot overcome their aggressive behaviour - but doesnapost believe Bear was in that category. There’s a dference between reactive and aggressive. He was reactive in a sense that he would bark a lot and sometimes lunge but he has never bitten anyone before or during his time at Battersea, he said, having spoken to staff there. But on attempting to find out more about Bearaposs brief spell at the charity, he was allegedly told it was a data protection issue.Grace went on to say, when she dropped Bear off at Battersea, he barked at a behaviourist and they said donapost let him near me, take him back, dashing out of the room after a few seconds. She said staff then told her to walk Bear to his kennel herself. The day after Battersea informed her Bear would be put to sleep she was told heaposd been moved to a aposcaution kennelapos away from other dogs and was no longer allowed out for his daily exercise or other activities. I feel that when I took him down to the kennels they’d already made their mind up about what they were going to do, Grace said. When Grace requested she be given his ashes she was told that it is not something they normally do as they conduct multiple cremations at a time. Grace said: I got Bear after a very hard time for myself, so me and him were very attached - we had an amazing bond. You feel as though they are your child and I’ve let him down. Blake said he believes there needs to be big changes going forward across the rescue sector. I think rescues need to take time, obviously, maybe change the environment of a kennel because essentially kennels haven’t really changed in the last  years. He said they must do more to mimic the home environment so dogs feel at ease and have a fair chance, while those thinking of adopting puppies must first understand the work and patience needed. A spokesperson for Battersea said: There is no maximumof stay for any animal in our care. Our staff work with every animal to understand whether any problem behaviours can be resolved with time, training and care, and are determined to achieve a positive outcome. Regrettably, despite our best efforts working with Bear, he did not show signs of improvement and his signs of aggression towards people and other dogs increased. When a dog in our care shows signs of stress in kennels, we will consider every option available, including the possibility of sending a dog to stay in a foster home. Unfortunately, this option was not possible for Bear due to the worrying behaviour he consistently displayed around new people. They said a contact of Graceaposs visited Battersea and offered to foster him but the team felt it would not be responsible of them to allow it. The spokesperson said it was agreed Grace could reclaim himshe agreed to seek behavioural advice from an expert and take precautions. After two days considering her decision, Bear’s owner informed us that she would not be able to take him back and staff explained that Bear would be put to sleep as previously discussed. His owner agreed that this should happen as soon as possible. Grace said she only finally agreed after their decision email was sent because she felt pressured as her landlord would not budge and she was worried about Bearaposs quality of le in the aposcaution kennelapos. The spokesperson said the percentage of dogs in the charityaposs care put to sleep in  was  percent, compared to  the year before. However, they failed to provide a full breakdown. They also did not provide any specics regarding Bearaposs worrying behaviour or exactly what their policies are which would support opting to put a dog to sleep within five days. news uk-news kate-middleton-reveals-books-loves-"Kate Middletons Hugs Young Boy Who Says He Loves HerByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |comments The Duchess of Cambridge has marked World Book Day by revealing five books she loves reading with Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. Kate has teamed up with her stepmother-in-law Camilla to launch a new childrenaposs book club on the Duchess of Cornwallaposs Reading Room website, which has also just launched.To mark the occasion she told of her favourite childrenaposs books - including one that features a character that shares the same name as Princess Charlotte. Among Kateaposs recommendations is Charlotteaposs Web, which she says is loved in our house for obvious reasons and describes it as a charming story about friendship, loyalty and love.  Another is Stig of the Dump, which Kate reveals was recommended to her by her dad Michael and says resonates with her as she loved spending time outdoors, making dens, digging, discovering and making things out of odds and ends as a child. Kate also recommends the Katie Morag Series by Mairi Hedderwick, which she describes as captivating as well as the book Feelings, which she says is a wonderful way to help children understand and recognise their feelings and emotions. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .The final book on the list is The Owl Who Was Afraid of the Dark, which Kate says is a comforting story to help children face their fears and grow in confidence with the help of others.Kate is already known to be a fan of this book, as last month she read it when she appeared on CBeebies Bedtime Stories.  The book, by Jill Tomlinson, tells the story of baby barn owl Plop, who is helped by others to grow in confidence and overcome his fears. At the end of the reading, she added: “Wow, what an encouraging tale. “We can all feel scared sometimes just like our little owl friend Plop, but as Mrs Barn Own said, ‘It’s better to find out about the things that scare us before we make up our mind’. “And with the help of others, we can often face things that worry us. Now it’s time for bed. Night night and sleep tight.”Meanwhile, Camilla has long been an advocate of literacy and reading and last week exclusively wrote in the Mirror about the books she likes reading to her grandchildren.Among them is Gangster Granny - a story about a grandmother who plots to steal the Queen’s Crown Jewels from The Tower of London. news uk-news kate-middleton-wore-earrings-special-"Duke and Duchess of Cambridge greet crowds in MonmouthshireByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |comments Most of us have trouble at some point when deciding what to wear for the day - not least the Duchess of Cambridge.She knows that whenever she is out and about on royal duties sheaposll have hundreds of photos taken of her and her outfit and accessories poured over. However, it seems a lot of thought actually goes into what Kate wears and she sometimes sends secret messages with her choices.And it appears when she and Prince William visited Wales earlier this week, she made a special effort with her earrings. The earrings were simple gold hoops that stood out against her bouncy, voluminous hair.  And it turns out they paid tribute to the place she was visiting - Wales - as they were made by a small Welsh jewellery brand called Spells of Love. The brand was founded by Hayley Jones, who runs the company with just her sister-in-law, and says each of her pieces is designed and ethically crafted with love and intention. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .And she was delighted when she realised Kate was wearing the brandaposs medium twist hoops that are made from recycled K gold vermeil on Tuesday. She told the Mirror: It was so lovely to see Her Royal Highness wearing them, it still feels very surreal!  I called my mum straight away, who then called all my family. It was incredibly exciting. She looked beautul and I am honoured to have Her Royal Highness wear our design. And not only was it a boost for Hayley, but she also says the impact itaposs had on her business has been amazing, with the earrings selling out within a day. She added: As a small business it has really helped put my company on the map. I have received orders from countries I would never have expected would ever know about my brand. It has helped my business immensely, Iaposm so grateful and honoured to have Her Royal Highness wear a design. Kate and William visited Wales in order to mark St Davidaposs Day - St David is the patron saint of Wales.During the trip, they learned about the importance of the agricultural industry for rural communities and how they celebrate the history of local regions. title: man loses everything after paying
story: Man loses everything after paying £, for funeral plan and company goes bustMichael Laws from Cleethorpes said he gave “everything I had” to Heavenly Services funeral company and now faces a paupers burialMichael Laws, , said he has been left facing the idea of a paupers funeral Image: Michael Laws   MEN MediaByChristian BrayfordJoe Smith:,  Mar |comments A man has been left facing a pauper’s funeral after he lost all his savings when a funeral firm collapsed.Michael Laws from Cleethorpes said he gave “everything I had” to the Heavenly Services funeral company to ensure his family wouldn’t have to worry about taking care of his funeral arrangements.But he has been left £, out of pocket, all his savings, after the firm announced it was going bust, with hundreds of customers told they were unlikely to see their money again. Michael decided to take out a funeral plan with the Hull-based Heavenly Services after friends recommended the company to him,GrimsbyLive reports .But the company fell into financial trouble in October following the sudden death of its founder and director Simon Woolston with branches in Hull, Bradford, Leeds, Scunthorpe, Grimsby and Bridlington forced to close.  Michael, , said he paid £, into the funeral service plan on Wednesday, June  last year, which included a cremation and for his ashes to be ed to his family. He said he has tried to get a refund from Heavenly Services but was told that because he paid in cash, he would be unable to recover the amount. Michael told Grimsby Live: I feel sick to death. I didnapost want a big fuss and just wanted to sort out my funeral. I can no longer afford my own funeral now because I donapost have that sort of money to put by now. That was everything I had. I have no-one to bury me or burn me. I have absolutely nothing. I suffer badly with anxiety and depression. Iaposm on medication three times a day just to keep me under control. They have left me with nothing but sadness and pain. Iaposve had to accept it because I have no choice. Michael is taking care of his mother who is seriously ill after having two strokes and developing Parkinsonaposs disease. The added stress has taken its toll on him and his -year-old mother. He said: Every time I see my mum, I just tell her that I donapost know whataposs happened. I donapost want to add any worry to her on top of what sheaposs already going through.  Mum suffers badly with health issues now along with a couple of strokes. Iaposm with her three times a day to make sure sheaposs cared for. She doesnapost need this added stress either. Itaposs so dficult because I donapost want to be that person who has a pauperaposs funeral because of this funeral service that has left me in the lurch. Itaposs just not right and now I canapost afford to be buried. Michael is just one of many customers struggling to get funeral money repaid.Bernard Skerrett, , died in October having contracted Covid- as well as suffering from Parkinson’s and an asbestos-related disease.Nikki McLoughlin, Bernardaposs daughter, told Hull Live that her parents had arranged cremation plans back in . After her father had passed away in October, a woman from Heavenly Services told her they were to aposcease trading with all the assets being frozenapos. The woman then suggested Nikki should find new funeral directors. An elderly couple said in October they were left in limbo and feared they could lose £, after paying up front for two cremation plans through Heavenly Services. The couple –  and  years old – said they had not heard what is happening with their cremation plan and whether they would get a refund. An insolvency firm last week all but confirmed to Hull Live that customers will not get their money back. Letters were sent out by insolvency firm Auker Rhodes informing customers Heavenly Services was to enter liquidation. Auker Rhodes said all company assets would be recovered and sold for the benefit of creditors. Humberside Police started an investigation in November after confirming they had received complaints from customers who had been affected by Heavenly Services.They told reporters today that their aposinvestigation into these reports continuesapos. Grimsby Live has made numerous attempts to contact Heavenly Services for comment. news uk-news meghan-markle-fans-convinced-predicted-"Meghan Markle plays a murderer princess in ABC’s Castle in ByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |comments Royal fans are convinced that Meghan Markle predicted her future as a princess a decade ago. Long before Meghan married Prince Harry, she was an actress, best known for her role as paralegal Rachel Zane, on the legal drama series Suits.Meghan also starred in an episode of the US TV series, Castle, in , in which she plays Charlotte Boyd, a woman who is linked to two of her murdered friends. The two main characters, detectives Richard Castleand Kate Beckett , are hunting the killer when they come across Meghanaposs character in a Sleeping Beauty costume – which is what fans believe basically foreshadowed her future as Prince Harryaposs we. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.Many people took to Twitter to comment on the connection, with one person writing: Rewatching @Castle_ABC and Meghan Markle is on the episode and it’s funny how she played a fairytale character and then lived one.Another put: Hubs and I watched a season  episode of Castle and one of the young actresses looked really familiar. IMDb to the rescue! It was Meghan Markle! Not only that, it was ironically a fairytale themed episode, and in her first scene she was dressed as a princess. I think Castle would describe Meghan Markle being in the episode based on fairytale characters princesses a bit ironic, said a third viewer. As another person put: Meghan Markle was on an episode of Castle, which was produced by ABC Studios, which is owned by Disney, which is why Archieaposs birth certicate doesnapost just reveal that she is a princess but a full-on Disney princess thank you for stumbling into my Ted Talk. When Meghan first started dating Harry she was determined to keep things on the down-low while she worked outhe was The One. And the pair successfully did that for five months, before the secret was out and their perfect, private bubble burst. When the press found out about them, the realisation that this was aposher new leapos terried Meghan, claims royal journalists, Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand. In their unofficial biography Finding Freedom, the authors said: Prior to meeting Harry, the only times she experiences cameras were on a set or on a red carpet. Shortly after the news broke, a photographer from an LA-based photo agency had scaled the fence into her back garden and waited for Meghan by her car, hoping to get a picture before she headed out to run errands. Meghan was terried and called the police. aposThis is how itaposs always going to be, isnapost it apos, she said to a friend.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news uk-news mysterious-fast-moving-ufo-resembling-"Plymouth: UFO spotted near SeatonByEdward ChurchJoe Smith:,  Mar |comments A man has recorded video of a strange, fast-moving light in the sky near his house, he said what appeared to be an orb of fire changed direction horizontally and vertically as he watched.Dan Pengelly was left baffled after he spotted the bizarre object in the night sky from his home overlooking the sea in Seaton in East Devon.Quick-thinking Dan whipped out his phone and started to record the unidentied object, capturing footage of what looks like an orange point of light moving across the night sky. Dan was enjoying a cup of tea at his open patio door at around pm when he was shocked to see a “big, round light” floating in the sky, Cornwall Live reports.He claims the object, which appeared much bigger to the naked eye, moved “faster than any satellite” and changed direction in a way that defied physics. “It looked like it was on fire,” Dan said, “But there’s no way it was a meteor or anything. It changed direction, horizontally in front of me then changed direction again out to see.  “I was just hypnotised, staring at it wondering, what the hell. “Then I went to get my phone, which took me about  seconds,” and by the time I got it out I could only get three small lots of footage. “I thought: ‘that’s some sort of weird bloody spacecraft.’” Dan said it appeared much larger to the naked eye than his video and images look. He also explained that the floating object moved around “very quickly,” much more so than any boat, plane or satellite.“I couldn’t get my head around it,” he continued, “It just looked like the bloody sun. It was huge. “Whatever it was, could have better technology, might have been in space going the speed of light. I wouldn’t bother it. “Never seen anything like it in my le.” Photos taken of the orb show it to be orange, slightly distorted-looking, and video footage taken by Dan shows it looking to be moving across the sky.  Askedhe’d ever seen what he thought to be a UFO before, Dan said: “There was one thing, actually, about  years ago, it was around here too- with my mate in a field.“It was winter, there was definitely a spacecraft. “I’ll admit we did have a smoke, and I said ‘Ollie look at that’. Went up and down, doing a triangle. Then it just went woosh away.” Dan said he felt sympathy for people who spot these sightings because they often get mocked on social media. However, he insisted that people who leave such comments would change their mindthey saw something like what he did. news uk-news norovirus-bug-cases-surge-england-"Everything you need to know: NorovirusBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |comments More warnings have been issued over the winter vomiting bug norovirus after outbreaks in care homes have risen in recent weeksUK Health Security Agency have moved to remind people of simple steps to take to limit the spread of the virus. Norovirus is highly contagious and causes vomiting and diarrhoea, but normally does not last much more than a couple of days.The virus spreads very easily in public places such as hospitals, nursing homes and schools where tiny particles of vomit or excrement enters a persons nose or mouth.The advice comes after routine surveillance in England shows that the number of outbreaks caused by the vomiting bug has increased in recent weeks.  From the four week period from end January to February, numbers are on the increase in educational settings and in care homes. Norovirus is highly infectious and causes vomiting and diarrhoea but usually passes in a couple of days. It is easily transmitted through contact with infected iniduals or contaminated surfaces. The increase in reported outbreaks was initially in educational settings, particularly in nursery and childcare facilities, with % more incidents reported to UKHSA than would be expected. Reports of norovirus outbreaks in care home settings have also increased in recent weeks, with a rise from  reported in week to  reported in week of .  While outbreaks reported in care home settings overall remain below pre-pandemic expected levels, it is likely they will continue to increase in the coming weeks, they say. Professor Saheer Gharbia, Gastrointestinal Pathogens  Food Safety Directorate, UKHSA, said: Norovirus, commonly known as the winter vomiting bug, has been at lower levels than normal throughout the pandemic but as people have begun to mix more, the numbers of outbreaks have started to increase again. Symptoms include sudden onset of nausea, projectile vomiting and diarrhoea but can also include a high temperature, abdominal pain and aching limbs.The six main symptoms Vomiting Watery diarrhoea Feeling sick Aching arms and legs A high temperature A headache How to reduce the spread of norovirus:Stay at homeyou are experiencing norovirus symptoms, the UK Health Security Agency say. Do notto work or send children to school until  hours after symptoms have cleared. Also avoid visiting elderly or poorly relatives, particularlythey are in hospital or a care home. Wash your hands frequently and thoroughly with soap and warm water. Alcohol hand gels don’t kill norovirus. When an infected person vomits, the droplets contaminate the surrounding surfaces. A bleach-based household cleaner or a combination of bleach and hot water should be used to disinfect potentially contaminated household surfaces and commonly used objects such as toilets, taps, telephones, door handles and kitchen surfaces. If you are ill, avoid cooking and helping prepare meals for others until  hours after symptoms have stopped, as norovirus can be spread through food contaminated by the virus when food is handled by symptomatic people infected iniduals. Wash any contaminated clothing or bedding using detergent and at °C, andpossible, wear disposable gloves to handle contaminated items. What to doyou have norovirus You are required to isolate by yourself at home until  hours have passed since the last time you were sick, doctors say.The NHS warned: “Stay off school or work until you have not been sick or had diarrhoea for at least  days.This is when youaposre most infectious. “Do not visit hospitals or care homes during this time.” The virus can survive outside the body for several days on contaminated food and so it is important for people to wash their hands regularly, especially before eating. People are most infectious from when symptoms start until  hours after all symptoms have passed. You may also be infectious for a short time before and after this. news uk-news prince-george-moving-schools-due-"Prince George sings ‘God Save the Queen’ at Six Nations matchByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |comments The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have reportedly been eyeing up schools in Berkshire for their eldest son Prince George.The family has long been rumoured to be relocating to Windsor and with George turning nine later this year, a change in his schooling could happen as early as this September, it is claimed. He currently attends St Thomasaposs Battersea alongside his younger sister Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis is also expected to enrol there later this year.And according to one royal expert, Georgeaposs rumoured school move could be down to a Royal Family tradition.Royal author Duncan Larcombe told OK! that itaposs actually unusual for royal children to all get their education at the same school. He explained: William and Harry broke the mould by going to the same school, butyou look at the Queenaposs children, they were all schooled separately. And, of course, William and Harry wouldnapost have gone to the same schoolone of them was a girl. Kate had a traditional co-ed education but it seems to be almost par for the course with the royals that they donapost pile all of their children into the same school. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .He also added that royals often want their children to have dferent experiences growing up and that picking the right school is crucial for their future lives.  Duncan said: There are little boys somewhere who will make friends with Prince George at his new school and may well be his right-hand men for the rest of their lives. Among the schools said to be in the running for Prince George is Lambrook - a co-education school near Ascot.Other schools they have reportedly looked at are Ludgrove Prep, St Andrews Pangbourne and Papplewick.  A source told the Daily Mail : Itaposs an open secret the Cambridges are looking to settle in Berkshire and George is set to leave Thomasaposs this summer, unless circumstances suddenly change.Itaposs the talk of the county and they will, of course, be made extremely welcome. aposThey always put their children front and centre of everything they do, so finding the right school has been a priority. Itaposs about what works for them as a family. title: putin must held account unforgivable
story: Putin must be held to account for an unforgivable assault that will cost many livesVladimir Putin has been slammed by leaders and citizens around the world for the Russian invasion into Ukraine which is expected to displace up to four million in total " content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _JS.jpg" width"" "" The Mirror readers condemn Putins calamitous miscalculation in invading Ukraine is backfiring badly now and say the world is uniting against him Image: ALEXEY NIKOLSKY Sputnik AFP via Getty ImagesopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Feb |commentsVlad must be judged With sanctions tightening, the EU closing airspace to Russian flights and Ukrainians fighting so valiantly to defend their country, Vladimir Putin is on the rack. Putin raised the awful spectre of nuclear confrontation because he’s losing, or at least not winning as easily as he expected. His calamitous miscalculation in invading Ukraine is backfiring badly now, and the world is uniting against him. He faces a battle at home too, as anti-war protests swell in Moscow and other cities. The pressure on Putin must be intensied, never relaxed, until he has withdrawn the last of his forces from the country he attacked.  And then he must face judgement. He must be held to account for an unforgivable assault that will cost many lives on both sides, including civilians. Many more are being forced to flee their homes in terror. Britain has sent military equipment and is picking up speed on sanctions but much more can be done to help Ukraine. Oligarchs close to Putin must be pursued relentlessly. And we should take in our share of Ukrainian refugees.  Plane  simple Lting remaining Covid travel restrictions, particularly the bureaucratic passenger locator forms, could ease flying without endangering public health. The evidence proving they helped reduce virus infections is almost non-existent. On the other hand, dropping a demand that the unvaccinated entering Britain take a test to prove they’re Covid-free is arguably more controversial. We deserve to see the science guiding Government decisions, because a resurgence of the virus would be terrible. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Let’s blast off Extracting oxygen from lunar rocks could help humans live on the Moon. And with an unhinged tyrant threatening to unleash his arsenal of nuclear weapons on this planet, the Moon sounds like the safest place to be in the near future. story: Sir Michael Caines gold Rolex sells for £, at auction Sir Michael Caine, , and his we Shakira decided to put film souvenirs, artwork, furniture and jewellery up for sale as they are downsizing their home. His gold Rolex sold for £,The watch sold for £, Image: BonhamsByNaomi Clarke:,  Mar |comments National treasure Sir Michael Caine has put his own private trove of mementoes up for auction, with one gold Rolex selling for £,.The Oscar winner, , and his we Shakira decided to put film souvenirs, artwork, furniture and jewellery up for sale as they are downsizing their home. A  oil painting by English artist John Bratby, which was expected to fetch £,, sold for £,. A pair of specs, estimated at £-, went for £,. Sir Michael’s own Indian rosewood desk fetched £,, and a poster from his  film Zulu made £,. Another portrait by English painter Lincoln Townley sold for £,, with proceeds going to the National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children.A director’s chair from the  crime film Get Carter also went for £, at Bonhams in London on Wednesday. A £, poster for  movie Alfie, which earned him an Oscar nomination, was included in items from his seven-decade screen career. title: teenager downed bottle vodka before
story: Teenager downed bottle of vodka before foul-mouthed attack on three police officersCleo McNally was trying to start a fight with her friend and was heard swearing and shouting during the incident on November  of last year in Macclesfield, a court heardCleo McNally has been sentenced to a community order for assaulting three police officers Image: KBPByAlice Peacock:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA teenager downed a full bottle of vodka before trying to start a fight with her friend and attacking three police officers, a court heard. Cleo McNally, , wrestled an officer for their baton during the rampage, it was also said in court. Police were dealing with another incident nearby when they were approached by a group of youths, including McNally.The -year-old was trying to start a fight with her friend and was heard swearing and shouting during the incident on November  of last year,Manchester Evening News reports.One of the officers asked her to stop swearing, at which she replied: “Don’t care, she’s a f***** little b***h” and “Do you think I actually care - she is a s**g”. The officer explained that children and elderly people were close and could hear her and again told her to stop swearing. She refused and then got close to the officer shouting abuse at the girl who was standing behind her, Stockport Magistrates Court heard.“She could see the defendant’s hand on her baton and pushed her hand back, and told her to go home,” Jeffrey Bird prosecuting said. “The defendant said: aposno, you f***** go homeapos and pushed her backwards. The officer tried to apprehend the defendant and gained control of her on the floor. “A struggle then ensued, and the officer had to be assisted by two other officers.” McNally, of Danes Square, Macclesfield, continued to resist and kicked out at all three police officers on Castle Street, Macclesfield. One was kicked to the wrist and knee, and the others were kicked to the knees. She was then arrested and taken for a police interview, in which she told officers she had been in an argument with her friend after drinking a full bottle of vodka. McNally said she remembered the police arriving but didn’t recall putting her hand on the officer’s baton - but did remember pushing them. She said she was ‘incredibly drunk’. The court heard she had one previous conviction for racially aggravated harassment when she was a youth. “She said in the midst of it, she did kick the officer but it wasn’t intentional,” Lesley Herman, defending, said. She is remorseful. There were no injuries - I don’t think the officers had any bruising.” McNally arrived almost two hours late to the afternoon hearing on Wednesday , and told Stockport JPs she believed the case was due to be heard the next day instead. “She was very concerned about being in court, she genuinely thought it would be heard tomorrow at am,” Ms Herman said. “Speaking of the offence, she was arguing with her friend, they were not involved in the other incident. They are still friends. She says, as a result of the incident, she is too scared to drink.” After berating her for being late and keeping the court waiting, JP Dominic Stone said: “You are going to have to learn to respect people in authority. “A police officer is there to serve and protect the whole community, including you. They show you courtesy, the least you can show to them is courtesy in . “This is going to land you in serious consequences. You were given the opportunity as a youth, and here you are again abusing a police officer - this has to stop.” McNally was sentenced to a  month community order,  days of rehabilitation activity requirements and  hours unpaid work. She must also pay £ compensation to each police officer. story: Three-bed house on sale for £, - and it comes with indoor swimming poolThe three-bedroom property based in Lincoln, East Midlands, has some other unexpected features including a jacuzzi bath and a garden on the roof of the extensionA -bed home on the market for £, even has an indoor poolByLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar |commentsA three-bedroom property has been listed on the market for £, - complete with an indoor swimming pool. The unique home in Lincoln, East Midlands, boasts features that potential buyers might not expect to find in an everyday three-bedroom house for under £,. The most notable feature of the home is the large extension at the rear of the building where a large swimming pool has been installed. Alongside the pool, there is a sunroof and windows that span the fullof the back wall of the room and even an adjoining shower room. The swimming pool room appears to just be slightly smaller than the sitting room, lounge, dining room and kitchen combined.An upstairs bathroom, which is carpeted, also features a jacuzzi style bath. The garden, which has been described as low maintenance, can be found on the roof of the extension.Although in need of a bit of an update, the house could be renovated to a high spec. And it has recently just had £, slashed from the price in a bid to entice buyers. Estate agent William H Brown said: Detached home for sale within the historic Cathedral city of Lincoln, the property is within ease of access to a wide range of amenities and bus route.Offering much more than meets the eye this property is not only conveniently located but boasts spacious accommodation including three bedrooms, a large  ft kitchen diner, two further reception rooms including a sitting room and lounge with bay window, further features include an indoor swimming pool with adjoining shower room and a family bathroom. Outside the property is approached via a block paved driveway and to the rear a fully enclosed well-established garden. The property became a talking point on social media yesterday with one Reddit user writing: Typical suburban three bed, with a pool taking up % of the downstairs.And another social media user said: Installing the pool would have cost more than the house was worth. title: airbnb host planted hidden cameras
story: Airbnb host planted hidden cameras and took , pics and videos of guests having sexJay Allee, , allegedly set up a camera facing the bed at his Airbnb in Comfort, Texas to spy on his guests when they were naked and having sexAirbnb host Jay Allee allegedly planted a hidden camera to record guests having sex Image: Kendall County Sherf’s OfficeByLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar The host of an Airbnb has been charged for allegedly spying on guests having sex and taking more than , videos and photos. A Jay Allee, , is claimed to have set up a camera at his cabin in Comfort, Texas, US, to spy on guests. Police said a guest found the hidden camera, which was made to look like a power adaptor and wi router, while the woman he was staying there with was taking a shower. He discovered it after looking online for ways to find secret recording devices.  The guest said the camera had been facing the bed, while Allee told them he had it set up to watch the sunrise naked or in pyjamas. Police found Allee had been recording people for a year after examining the camera, a tablet, phones and laptops he owned. There were a total of , photos and videos of people naked, half-dressed and having sex. Bianca Zuniga-Goldwater, representing  of the people who stayed at Alleeaposs AirBnB, said the situation was like a real le scary movie.  On his arrest in November, Allee was charged with four counts of invasive visual recording. Now he faces  counts with lawsuits that accuse him of causing emotional distress intentionally and invasion of privacy. One of Alleeaposs lawyers Nico LaHood said his client is looking forward to his day in court, insisting he is innocent. A spokesperson from AirBnB said: The reported criminal behavior of this bed-and-breakfast owner is outrageous, and he and his property are banned from Airbnb. Our law enforcement operations team has been working to support the Kendall County Sherf’s Office in their investigation. title: woman 29 daily encounters aliens
story: Woman, , has daily encounters with aliens after first UFO visit during lockdownLily Nova, , from St Louis, Missouri, US, says she had her first encounter with aliens in November  after taking up astrophotography to cure her lockdown boredomLily Nova, , took up astrophotography in  to cure her lockdown boredom Image: Caters News AgencyByBeth KilgallonRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A woman who claims to have spotted a UFO during lockdown says sheaposs been visited by aliens ever since. Lily Nova, , from St Louis, Missouri, US, says she had her first encounter at the end of  after taking up astrophotography to cure lockdown boredom.But the encounters did not stop there, with Lily now claiming the extraterrestrial beings visit her on a daily basis. Theyaposve approached her in all manner of spacecraft, including metallic ships, black triangles and orbs that move in an unearthly way, she claims. She also says she knows what some of the beings look like.  She first started getting into astrophotography in the summer of  during the lockdown which eventually led to her first encounter with aliens just a few months later, in November. She said: My first encounter with aliens and UFOs was very intense. I went outside for some fresh air one night and I immediately locked eyes with bright light hovering over the neighbourhood.I started investigating and realised it was a UFO. Seconds later I looked away briefly and when I looked back there was a second craft that was much closer.I could actually see the triangular shape of the craft. The UFOs did some impressive manoeuvres to show me that it wasnapost a regular aircraft before they disappeared above me. It really spooked me because aliens and UFOs arenapost something I have thought about much before. It was a total reality shting experience.A couple of months later I had my second encounter. After that, it kept happening more frequently and now I am having experiences daily. During my encounters I have also been able to see what the beings look like. One of the first beings I saw was a girl with light blue skin. She had no hair, but she was very beautul. She was wearing a skin tight grey suit and I saw her ship mates standing behind her in the same unorm. I have also seen another group of beings with light blonde hair, fair and glowing skin and bright blue eyes. I believe they send images of themselves to me through telepathy. I think they are easing me into an introduction as it would be such a shocking experience for any human to have an alien walk up to you. Lily believes that the aliens were testing the waters with her after her first shocking encounter as she says they were motioning towards her and knew she was recording. She thinks that they then gave her some space to process the experience before appearing to her again.  Lily added: My encounters have been very close from the start. I could not believe what I was seeing, it was groundbreaking and it piqued my interest in astrophotography even more. I needed to find out as much as possible. I abandoned my career as a nutritionist because it was overtaken by my passion for finding out more about UFOs and aliens. Itaposs not something I ever expected to happen.The shock of my encounters with the UFOs eventually turned to comfort as I had more and more experiences.It felt like I was developing a relationship with them.These experiences have changed everything for me. It has totally changed my view of the world and I have learnt so much about the cosmos and other beings. I have been focusing on spreading awareness of what I have found. Lily now believes that she can invite these experiences with aliens and UFOs when is she is in a relaxed, open and blissful state of mind. She says that she has even developed a sixth sense and intuitive gut feeling for when they are going to appear to her. Lily added: Whenever I am out doing my creative passion, astrophotography, this is when I believe I can make contact and invite these encounters. During my first initiated contact, where I have invited them instead of them just showing up, I even received a vision of being on the space ship and of the ships crew members. I have been out with a friend who is experienced in meditation, and we set our intention for them to appear to us, and within five minutes of getting out the car, a bright golden orb appears and was moving around to our questions. Since the shock wore off, I just feel joy, love and peace. They are such beautul and positive experiences, sometimes I even ball my eyes out crying while itaposs happening. I believe that they come to me because I believe in them, I am open-minded and I am welcoming towards them. It has been fascinating to learn about the universe and to create the incredible connection that has been formed. title: company wants pay you 5000
story: Company wants to pay you £ to snf your dogs poo for eight weeksThe job role will require the owner to record their dog’s experience with the transition from their usual diet to a plant-based diet by noting the colour and consistency of each stool their dog producesThe owner will have to switch their dog to a plant-based diet for two months Image: Getty ImagesByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA plant-based dog food company is looking to pay a dog owner £, to snf their dog’s poo over an eight-week period. OMNI, the dog food brand, wants the successful candidate to record their experience of moving their dog to a veterinary-formulated plant-based diet, which will involve them smelling their dog’s poo daily - a possible indicator of digestive health.As well as monitoring stools, the candidate will also be required to monitor their dog’s health, energy levels and behaviour. The brand states that it hopes the successful candidate can start as soon as possible on a salary of £, per month for the two-month role with the unusual poo-snfing duty.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. As well as the free two-month supply of plant-based food and the support from a dog nutritionist, the successful candidate will have the option to get discounted products for a yearthey want their dog to remain on the diet following completion of the role. Shiv Sivakumar, dog lover and co-founder of OMNI said: “We’ve had lots of feedback from dog owners who report that their dogs’ digestion, energy levels and general health are all improved once switching to a flexitarian or plant-based diet. Not only that, we are getting feedback that their dogs’ stools have improved in terms of colour, consistency and smell. So, what better way to demonstrate this than by being willing to pay a dog owner to snf their dog’s poop once they’ve switched to our brand of dog food  “We know that this is quite a peculiar vacancy but we also know that this is the way for us to put our money where our mouth is and show dog owners that plant-based dog food could improve their dog’s stool, general health and digestive health. The proof is in the poop andyou consider yourself to be the Gillian McKeith of the dog world, then apply now!” The novel plant-based job vacancy for the candidate and their four-legged friend comes from OMNI’s vision of helping dogs live healthy lives whilst lowering the carbon paw print on the planet by introducing meat-free or flexitarian diets. OMNI understands there is a pre-existing and negative connotation in feeding your dog a plant-based diet and wants to communicate the benefits it can have on dogs.Applicants must be over the age of  and own a dog with a current non-plant-based diet. Job applications close on March  and those hoping to apply for the role can do so here.Do you have a strange dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: groom ghosts fiance wedding day
story: Groom ghosts fiance on wedding day after seeing saucy video from her hen doA woman ended up getting stood up by her husband-to-be on their wedding day after he was sent a saucy video of what really went down at her bachelorette partyHer husband-to-be ghosted her on their wedding day Image: GettyByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments When you think about it, stag and hen dos - or bachelor and bachelorette parties - are a bit of a strange concept. One night of freedom before settling down with the person you vow to spend the rest of your le with. But how far should that night of aposfreedomapos actually go, and is it actually acceptable to do things on your stag or hen do that you would never normally do while in a relationship  Most of us would agree that cheating on a stag or hen do is still cheating, no matter when it happened, and one bride-to-be recently found out the hard way that bachelorette behaviour will still have consequences. In fact, it wasnapost until her wedding day when the anonymous bride found out that her husband-to-be had stood her up, that her ex-fiancé had discovered what sheaposd been up to on her last night of freedom - and he wasnapost happy.It turned out that the brideaposs sister had sent her fiancé a rather saucy video taken at the bachelorette party, in which the bride was seen supping up chocolate sauce which dripped from a male stripperaposs private parts. Keep it classy, people.Sharing the story on Twitter, a woman who posts from the handle Pink Blossom, posted: Dam man ghosted his fiancé on their wedding day cuz she had a bachelorette party and a video was sent to him from her sister of the male stripper having chocolate drip off his private part into her mouth lol [sic].The wedding guest later went into a little more detail, explaining that the sister had purposely sent the video as an act of revenge after her sister demoted her from Maid of Honour to bridesmaid. Sister was lame af for that she was tryna get revenge cuz her sister down graded her from a matron of honor to a bridesmaid lol… [sic], she wrote. People on Twitter were left ided over the whole situation, with one writing: The right thing would’ve been telling her sister not to do it instead of watching, recording, and THEN sending it to her fiancé. Nah her sister did the right thing, another disagreed. She could just have integrity and didnapost want this man to be hurt knowing he ainapost deserve it.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it.
